intro: Demorchis boninensis, commonly known as the Bonin orchid, is a rare flowering plant native to the Bonin Islands. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, greenish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas with sandy or rocky soil, thriving in humid, saline environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered an endangered species. Conservation efforts are ongoing to protect this unique botanical specimen.
